name: Domain-specific: healthcare records with privacy invariants

context.domain: Patient health record portal for a multi-clinic network
invariants: Protected health information (PHI) must be encrypted at rest and in transit
Every access to patient records must be logged with viewer identity and reason
Patients must be able to revoke data sharing consent at any time
Break-the-glass access requires documented justification within 24 hours

userMessages.content: Patients need to view their health records, lab results, and visit summaries through a web portal. They should also be able to share records with other providers.

Records come from our Epic EHR system via FHIR APIs. Patients see their data read-only. They can grant time-limited access to external providers by generating a sharing link that expires after 30 days. The link requires the receiving provider to authenticate.

Patients can see who has viewed their records and when - a full audit trail visible to them. They can revoke any sharing link at any time. Mental health and substance abuse records have extra protections - they're excluded from sharing by default and require explicit patient opt-in.
Emergency access: any provider in our network can access any patient record in an emergency. But they must document the reason within 24 hours or their access is flagged for compliance review.

expectedOpenQuestions: How should the system handle EHR downtime or unavailability?
What notification should patients receive when their records are accessed?
Should the portal support proxy access (e.g., parents viewing children's records)?
